thread.title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte recognises similarities between himself and N’Golo Kante… but insists scores more goals than the Frenchman
thread.title_full: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte recognises similarities between himself and N’Golo Kante… but insists scores more goals than the Frenchman

author: leeastley
title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte recognises similarities between himself and N’Golo Kante… but insists scores more goals than the Frenchman
text:
Antonio Conte revealed some managers tried to stop him from running in training PA:Press Association 7 Chelsea boss Antonio Conte insists he will not try and stop N'Golo Kante 
Giovanni Trapattoni tried to curb Conte at Juve, while Claudio Ranieri wanted Kante to save himself for matchdays at Leicester. 
Conte said: “I don’t want to stop him. In my career I remember Trapattoni tried to stop me during training, telling me to go into the changing room because I had to run during the game. 
“I wasn’t happy about that. I wanted to stay with my team-mates. 
“N’Golo is a great player and he always puts 100 per cent in the game — but also in training. I never tried to send him inside.” 
Conte has warned the rest of the Premier League that Kante can get even better with more positive passing and adding goals to his game. 
He said: “I always try to improve my players through work. 
“To work very hard to try and improve them. We are talking about great players. He played very well last season with Leicester and he’s playing very well this season with us. Latest in football CUP FOR GRABS LIVE - Tottenham vs Millwall: London derby in FA Cup quarter-final at White Hart Lane in bid to reach Wembley Madrid come calling David De Gea given May deadline by Real Madrid or they will turn Chelsea's Thibaut Courtois PREM SUNDAY LIVE - Liverpool vs Burnley: Jurgen Klopp's Reds look to boost top four bid as they host Clarets QUITE A FOLLOWING Cristiano Ronaldo is the followed sports star on Twitter and Instagram in a top 10 dominated by football players 2 Ron Rons Cristiano Ronaldo 'to be dad of twins' as surrogate mother revealed to be expecting 'very soon' BATTLE AT THE BRIDGE Paul Pogba misses out in our combined XI ahead of Chelsea vs Manchester United, but there are more Red Devils than Blues in the team Weng's it going to end? Team News Tottenham vs Millwall: What is the latest team news, what time does it start and what TV channel is it the FA Cup clash on? Getty Images 7 Paul Pogba was managed by Antonio Conte back at Juventus 
“We are working on some aspects to try and improve him, to make him a more complete player. 
“We are talking about someone who is already a great player. 
“But I think he has a lot of room to improve in his passing and to look for the first pass forward. He can improve on these aspects.” 
Chelsea take on Manchester United in tomorrow’s crunch FA Cup quarter- final at Stamford Bridge . 
And Conte goes up against Pogba — who he helped turn into a superstar after signing him at Juventus. 
He added: “I had the opportunity to train with Paul for many years. EPA 7 Paul Pogba has completed over 1,000 passes in the opposition half this season 
“We are talking about a top player. A top player in his commitment in training, trying to improve, good technique, physically strong, great stamina. 
“We are working to try to find the right solution for the whole team, not only for Paul Pogba. It was the same against West Ham, when we played against Andy Carroll and there were questions about whether we would try and stop him. 
“For sure, we are studying Manchester United to try and find the right solution. 
“Paul is a really good player and we must pay great attention to him, above all when he arrives in the box. 
“But we must think about the whole Manchester United team. They are very strong.”
